biography.summary: Ben Ray Luján is the junior United States Senator from New Mexico, serving since 2021. A Democrat, he previously served as U.S. Representative for New Mexico's 3rd congressional district from 2009 to 2021, including a term as Assistant Speaker (2019-2021).

contact.office_address: 498 Russell Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports expanding access to affordable healthcare and protections for Medicare.
Supports federal investments in public education and student loan relief.
Supports clean energy initiatives and emission reduction policies.

timeline.event: Elected to the U.S. House of Representatives from New Mexico's 3rd district; term began January 2009.
Became Assistant Speaker of the House.
Took office as United States Senator from New Mexico (Class 2).
